meanings.definition: Wasting time in a petty way
meanings.sent1: He spent the afternoon piddling around in the garden, not accomplishing anything.
meanings.sent2: She always piddles away her time on meaningless tasks instead of focusing on important work.
meanings.sent3: The cat piddled lazily in the sun, enjoying the warmth on its fur.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to piddle by slowly as they waited for the train to arrive.
meanings.sent5: The students piddled through the boring lecture, doodling in their notebooks.

meanings.definition: To spend time in a wasteful or ineffective manner
meanings.sent1: He would often piddle away his weekends watching mindless TV shows.
meanings.sent2: She regretted piddling her time on social media instead of studying for the exam.
meanings.sent3: The team piddled around during practice, leading to a disappointing performance in the game.
meanings.sent4: She felt guilty for piddling the whole day without completing any of her tasks.
meanings.sent5: The artist would piddle for hours in front of a blank canvas, waiting for inspiration to strike.
